avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Wet snow can be problematic. Small wet glide-snow avalanches are possible in all aspects on very steep slopes over smooth ground that have not yet discharged. In addition, small wet loose snow avalanches can release spontaneously on extremely steep slopes with still enough snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Only little snow on the ground, therefore, wet avalanches stay small.

snowpackStructure.comment: Arising clouds will prevent the formation of a massive melt-freeze crust during the night. Due to milder temperatures, dense clouds and showery precipitation the snowpack soaks increasingly. In south-facing terrain there is barely any snow left up to high altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is moderate. Main problem: moistening of the snowpack. Even during the course of the morning wet loose snow avalanches can release spontaneously in extremely steep terrain. In addition, glide-snow avalanches are possible at anytime in all aspects on very steep slopes over smooth ground that have not yet discharged, in sparsely wooded deciduous forests, or on smooth rock slabs. Avoid stopping or staying below zones with glide cracks. Where there is still enough snow, wet avalanches can attain medium size.

snowpackStructure.comment: Arising clouds will prevent the formation of a massive melt-freeze crust during the night. Due to milder temperatures, dense clouds and showery precipitation the snowpack soaks increasingly. In south-facing terrain there is barely any snow left up to high altitudes.

tendency.highlights: The snowpack recedes gradually, as does avalanche danger.

customData.generalHeadline: Wet snow can be problematic even in the morning.
